abstract.p: This paper examines the differences of design between Chinese and western social media. Using a blandness in society of Fran?ois Jullien's interpretation approach, this paper analyzes the mainstream social media, found that both Chinese and western social media design concept have the characteristic of being "as pleasing to the taste as new wine" in terms of social communication; comparing to western social media, the Chinese social media have traces of being "as bland as water".

div.head: Introduction
div.p: Social media can be considered as not only a product, but a medium. A majority of previous researches on social media focus on product attributes, product's usability and availability, description of usage scenarios, and the influence of product commercialization on users. These research methods and orientation regarding social media focus mainly on social product design, dissemination of users' information, or indirect expression of dependency of social media to social and cultural environment. However, studies from the perspective of the Chinese and western social thoughts differences have not yet been developed. In order to study the impact of the Chinese and western social thoughts on China's social media design concept, changing of research method should be implemented firstly, followed by definition of research scope.

This paper selects the Chinese and western mainstream social media including Sina Weibo, WeChat and Facebook as the discussion objectives and concentrate its study in "advertising creation" and information framework related to page design. Starting from social media "advertising creation", this paper discusses differences in the Chinese and western social media design concepts from the perspective of product design framework and technique, as well as of page commercial interest and customer satisfaction.

div.head: B. Analysis of the Chinese and western social media advertising
div.p: In China, Sina Weibo and WeChat are two representatives of social media which have the largest scale and conduct more exploration against business modes of information flow advertising. Li Xiaoling, Song Yurong, Wu Bin et al (2014) said in the study that ad types of Sina Weibo mainly included formal (banner) ad, recommendation ad, keyword search ad, Microblog talks and Microblog live broadcasting. Facebook has the major forms of advertising including right-hand ads, newsfeed, sponsored story, page posted ads, search bar and so on [4].

In studies on the Chinese and western social media advertising, three common points can be found: the first comes to similar advertising model; secondly, online form of business users is similar. Thirdly, individual users comprise secondary media for advertising. They utilize number of fans to act as a secondary media on FB, twitter, Weibo and WeChat, implant and promote businesses advertising. There are two different points: firstly, There is no essential difference between part of advertising model in Weibo and WeChat and the ads in previous Internet portal; Secondly, the link for "advertising" is very hidden, and hints about "advertising creation" will generally not appear on user interface.

div.head: Research questions approach
div.p: This paper is designed to investigate differences in social media design concepts between the Chinese and western countries, and takes interpretation of General Philosophy and the Chinese Thought from a French philosopher Jullien as the research approach. In addition, it analyzes the differences in social media design concepts between the Chinese and western countries with literature analysis method. To avoid product iteration of the object and prevent from influence of continually updated algorithm, this paper observes and collects pages from the same user, and selects new user account registered at the same time. div.head: A. Interpretation of "Blandness"
div.p: Jullien believed that the Chinese intersect blandly, just as dealings with the Gentleman are as bland as water [5]. In the study, he firstly quoted the Taoist view to explain that the social interaction advocated by Taoists was natural and sincere, not sophisticated. Secondly, he cited viewpoint of Confucius and combined with a short story in The Book of Rites to explain subtle interpersonal relationships in China. "Blandness" indeed appears in product designing of China's social media created by Weibo and WeChat. The design concept of WeChat is to establish the relationship among different people. As for newly registered users, WeChat interface only displays users added by users themselves. If a user takes no initiative to add an official account (such as FB fans page), he/she will not be interfered by ads that are released by this account. And users can unsubscribe any advertising recommended by wechat in moments( fig.1).

In order to prevent users from ad interference, Weibo classifies the "News feed" into " Moments", "Group Weibo", "Pet" and other labeled communities. No ads will appear to "Moments", and there are ads appearing in other labeled communities (see figure 2). Therefore, upon comparison, Weibo overtops WeChat in terms of "Blandness". This difference is connected with the ideological difference between China and western countries. Western countries tend to "tell you everything" and let the customers make their own decisions. "How to choose" is an issue of user initiative, and the responsibility of social media is to list detailed pages with pictures and texts. Therefore, there is detailed illustration in the "setting" column of FB to explain why users can see the advertisements ( fig.5). Such design concept is like Descartes' pursuit for truth. Everything comes from deduction and discrimination. For Chinese people, it is not necessary to prove the existence of something by means of inference and accumulation. For this reason, users can seldom find explaining pages in Chinese social media such as "moments; news feed; why you can see this advertisement". div.head: Conclusions
div.p: The difference between the design concepts of China and western countries comes from the ideological difference of Chinese and western users for "social intercourse". In the capital economic environment of globalization, the "sweet wine" of social intercourse has become the commonality for the development of social media's design. Furthermore, products are being optimized by user-oriented design ideas, which have been used to coordinate the contradictions between customer need and commercialized development. Although the taste of sweet wine is attractive, there is no integrity and rigor. This also reflects the problem of privacy right confronted by social media in the process of development. The design thinking different from western social media lies in the blandness of social intercourse. Maybe, because Chinese people have never discussed the truth by means of discrimination since ancient times, the design thinking of Chinese social media has the spirit of "blandness". Only on the foundation of implication, modesty and prudence can product designers "achieve" reliable and righteous social media platform and provide users with the design and service they really need.
